{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561266,"name":"Michael Romberger","username":"MichaelRomb","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/43a26b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T23:35:48.392Z","cooked":"

I am using a radiomaster tx12 for driving and that is working fine but no matter what I do I cant get any of my commands to call. They were working a week ago until we tried running the robot off a different laptop then they quit working.

I am not certain…plug in your drive controller in then your additional one. We had that issue last weekend during a qual match.

Turn on your drive station and test both for response.

I hope this is your problem.

Thanks, I checked to make sure the order was correct and that I was getting input from it on the driver station but still no response from it. I’ve also tried a different joystick and tried mapping commands to our drive controller and neither of those work. I checked the driver station log and I’m getting an overloop warning and it says there’s 1 warning in the conveyor subsystem but I can’t find anything that would be causing either.

If you are on Windows type Windows+R and then joy.cpl if you do see your seperate controller in there then the problem is your computer if you don’t the problem is the joystick/usb port.
